text: @succ.ulent_ I wasn't comparing the consequences - just the mindset. Who knows what the consequences of the kind of anti-male sentiment being promoted here will be. Not suggesting it's a problem on a par with racism but that's not a reason to not call it out. Time will tell.
@succ.ulent_ Ok well sorry to hear that.
@tommieinthemiddle the stereotype that all black people are criminals leads to police brutality, but men rape women and get little to no prison time. very equal comparison btw

@tommieinthemiddle different circles? i’d love to leave it there.... but different circles? i hear it from my father, i hear it from my school teachers, i hear it from my church leaders, i hear it anywhere online.... this issue is prevalent no matter where you are

@succ.ulent_ if you hear that kind of comment often you've somehow found yourself in cluster of dickheads. Try to move in different circles.  There are very very few men I know who'd say that. Incidentally it's the mindset of the ad I also have  a problem with. Maybe we're not so different. If we can leave it there that might be good.
@succ.ulent_ I have no problem with that message. Just the sexist bundling of me or anyone else in with, yes, a small number of total assholes because I happen to share their gender.

@tommieinthemiddle to respond to what you said about being “offended”: i don’t care about being “offended”... i care about the mindset behind sexist remarks. i know that if a guy says something like “she was asking to get raped” (something i hear quite often) that he’s the type of guy that a) justifies rape and should not be trusted b) i should avoid him at all costs. sure it hurts to hear that, but i’m more worried about my safety than i am my feelings.

@tommieinthemiddle men aren’t monsters. i’m well aware of that, thank you. the ad itself calls on normal men to stand up for women being preyed on, to stop the men that are the ones abusing. the ad itself never says all men. my intent was never to say “all men do this” but that “enough men do this that it is massive problem in society”

@succ.ulent_ eh... you're really proving my point that there's a most-men-are-bad message being pushed out there.  You're pushing it right now with your 'almost every man I know dared to offend me or my femake friends' . You are just plain sexist all you're saying is that it's justified. As to the figures, for the US where there are around 150 million men, no matter how you slice them (yes I looked) the vast majority of men have no association whatsoever with sexual assault of any kind or anything criminal at all. As to hearing people say hurtful things to each other, that goes for all humans. Implying men are monsters is certainly not going to make them less inclined to offend you.
@tommieinthemiddle if you need statistics of how many women are raped, assaulted, and abused by men, it’s easy to find on the internet
@tommieinthemiddle it’s not a small number of men that are sexist- i’ve heard almost every man i know say something incredibly hurtful and rude to women
@tommieinthemiddle honey....men are not repressed....idk what to tell ya if you think they are

So it's ok to be sexist against men because some assholes are sexist against women? Taking the negative behaviour of a small number of people and then holding a much much larger group collectively accountable simply because they share a gender with those people is sexist and wrong. Who cares how the group being stereotyped react? It's wrong. If an ad came out asking black people to stop each other mugging people would you be saying "I don't get it - they're just asking black people to be decent human beings!" Don't be a hypocrite.
@jailyn_g._ it’s about toxic masculinity. there’s the link: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=koPmuEyP3a0
